oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Discussion - Highway 40 Blues: The transformation of Jefferson Street - 2004-09-25
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Panel discussion on the history of Nashville's Jefferson Street from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on September 25, 2004. In support of the exhibit Night Train to Nashville: Music City Rhythm & Blues, 1945-1970.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Reavis Mitchell; Sharon Hurt; Don "Sonny' Tyler; Earl Gaines; Robert Craighead; David Padgett;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Includes questions from the audience / (00:00) Recording begins in progress / (00:14) Introduction of Dr. Reavis Mitchell and he talks about the history of Jefferson Street prior to the Civil War / (01:44) Introduction of panel participants / (04:24) Robert Craighead talks about his recollections of Jefferson Street / (06:08) Earl Gaines talks about the music on Jefferson Street / (07:24) Sonny Tyler talks about the Stealaway club / (08:06) Why the club business on the street went down / (08:38) Dr. David Padgett comments on the historical typographic and geography of the area and it's possible future / (10:17) Sharon Hurt comments on her hopes for the area / (12:45) Robert Craighead with memories of Jefferson Street and his changing customer base when Interstate 40 was built / (14:40) Earl Gaines with memories musical moments on Jefferson Street / (17:08) Sonny talks about the Steal-Away Club and late hour activities /

(18:22) David comments on more recent activities and changes in the area / (21:31) Sharon talks about the business there now and future businesses needed for the area / (23:40) Sharon with her memories Jefferson Street of homecoming parades on the street and the first African American Fire Hall in the country being built on Jefferson Street / (25:17) Safety issues on the street / (26:10) Dr. Mitchell with his memories of the area / (27:04) Local University staff and students visits to Craighead's Barbershop / (27:55) Earl Gaines with more memories of playing music and working in the clubs on the street / (30:10) Sonny tells about how he acquired the Stealaway club / (31:03) Sharon asked to compare Jefferson Street to Beale Street in Memphis / (32:30) Dr. Mitchell with his favorite story about African American proprietary interests on the street / (35:45) Dr. Patton with his thoughts about the trend of the population moving from the urban core to the suburbs /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Mitchell, Reavis; Hurt, Sharon; Tyler, Don; Gaines, Earl, 1935-2009; Craighead, Robert; Padgett, David; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
